body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3888,"title":"School Closure Update","body":"
School Closure Extends through April 30, 2020.



Hello Sweetwater #1 Families,

In following the public health orders of Governor Gordon and State Health Officer Dr. Harriest, Sweetwater County School District Number One will continue to close schools through April 30, 2020 as part of the state-wide effort to slow community transmission of coronavirus (COVID-19) and protect lives.



While school buildings are closed, the District will continue with our adaptive online learning plan that started this week and will now continue at least through April 30, 2020. Sweetwater Number One will continue to provide meals to our students as currently in place and support our families as much as possible during this difficult time. By properly planning from the start, we are able to continue with our student learning and nutrition programs.

As we continue to navigate these stressful days, please know we are all doing our best, cognizant of all the impact each decision has on our students, families and community. Let’s continue to use these times to lift each other up as we unite in service to your students first and foremost.

Sweetwater Number One is a place for all of us.

","dateStart":"2020-03-16T01:39:02Z","baseGroupName":"Sweetwater County School District #1","hash":"IeRuQfp5wra+Rp2759u/gRC1M5d5obp3qi6wig3yIj8=","updateDate":"2020-04-04T00:27:04Z"}];

img.alt: Sweetwater County School District #1 Home Page

div.p: Tonight, we are recognizing Tina Searle and Ron Urbin for the efforts they have made in instilling PBIS District wide. Tina has made enormous progress in establishing a PBIS process at Eastside and ensuring that students and staff are safe and cared for. You have accomplished so much in a short amount of time. Ron is doing an amazing job of making sure that PBIS is fully engrained within the school. He has even posted the PBIS updates in the faculty bathrooms! Thank you both for your support.

Tamara Jackson, State Director of Nutrition and Amanda Anderson, Nutrition Consultant of the Wyoming Department of Education will be addressing the Board on the Summer Food Service Program and the impact it has had for the students in Rock Springs

Rock Springs High School drama students returned from the Wyoming State Thespian Festival in December with a second-place award in the sweepstakes competition – the high school’s top finish ever. The competition is annually organized by the Wyoming Educators of Secondary Theatre and hosted by the University of Wyoming Department of Theatre and Dance. The three-day event in Laramie is dedicated to presenting and adjudicating the performance, technical and design work of Wyoming theater students. Students from more than 30 Wyoming high schools competed in a variety of performance and design events, including monologues, scenic design and costume design. Each school could also bring one group performance in proscenium, arena or devised.
Representing the troupe tonight are the following individuals from the Thespian Student Leadership:

President Damaris Ruiz
Vice-President Catie Spann
Public Relations Destiny Britton
Secretary Mikayla Shauers
Technical Lead Jaden Tijerina
Troupe Director R. Sterling Merrill
Congratulations Tiger Thespian Troupe for being awarded the 4A State Sweepstakes Runner Up!

Sweetwater #1 Foundation Stepping Stone Scholarships are open and ready for applications. These scholarships are for students graduating from Sweetwater #1 in the 2019-2020 school year. More information can be found here: https://form.jotform.com/60834128720957

h3.strong: Facility Use Requests may be filled out by clicking here.

div.p: Free meals through Nutrition Services will be available starting March 23 – 27, 2020 and March 30 – April 3, 2020 for all students and any individual under the age of 19, enrolled student or not. All individuals under the age of 19 are eligible to eat for free. This opportunity also includes children that are not school age (i.e. 3 year olds, toddlers, etc.).
Families will need to practice social distancing when buses arrive for deliveries. Children do not need to be present and breakfast and lunch meals can be picked up by parents/guardians.

a.strong: For the full list of drop-off locations, please click here.

div.p: Sweetwater School District Number One will be following the recommendation of Governor Gordon and State Superintendent Balow to close the District schools beginning March 16 with a tentative return date of Monday, April 6. It is in the best interest of community health and efforts to limit the spread of COVID-19. We appreciate your patience and cooperation as we work through the school closure in order to best meet the needs of our students, staff, and community. For more details regarding school closures, please click here.

strong.a: Message from HR Director Nicole Bolton

div.p: Online Schooling will begin Wednesday, March 25th. Families will be able to pick up their IT Go-Bags at your child’s school from 9:00 - 12:00 p.m. on Tuesday, March 24, 2020 to pick up your technology and curriculum. Do not exit your vehicle. The equipment will be brought to your car by District staff. Families and students will receive information from their child’s teachers. This will be content that your student really needs to know for the next couple of weeks. Please be patient. For some, this is a new format. Take time to learn the platform and how things work. Keep the communication going with teachers.

There will be ample technical support available to our students, staff, and families available during regular school hours for each of our school sites beginning March 25, 2020 from 8:00 - 4:00 p.m. Information for technology support can be found here.
